Positive Emotions.instructions:
Instructions: Positive emotions are emotions such as joy, excitement, motivation, enthusiasm, happiness, interest, love, and gratitude. Positive emotions broaden our thinking and behavior which helps us to develop physical, social, and psychological resources. For instance, if you experience gratitude in your relationships, you appreciate those people more, and that has the potential to enhance your relationship satisfaction. Studies show that people who experience greater positive emotions have greater physical health, more meaning and happiness in their lives. The goal of this exercise is to become aware of the experiences that bring you and toward your positive emotions. 

Please start by rating your positive emotions and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: I experience feelings of joy in a typical day
Describe the experiences that typically bring up positive emotions for you: What are you doing? Who are you with? What emotions do you experience in those moments?
Describe the experiences that typically block you from experiencing these emotions: What are you doing? Who are you with? What emotions do you experience in those moments?

Engagement.instructions:
Instructions: Engagement is all about Flow, which is an experience where you are absorbed in the present moment. You’ve definitely experienced it sometime in your life, whether you were exercising, talking to a friend or working on a hard project in school or at work. During Flow, we normally perform optimally with high levels of Well being. Studies show that people who experience flow more often are more creative, and productive, and have higher levels of well being. The goal of this exercise is to become aware of your flow experiences so that you can develop ways to experience them more often. 

Please start by rating your engagement and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: I typically feel fully absorbed in what I am doing
Please spend some time describing experiences you feel fully engaged with during a typical day: What are you doing? Who are you with? How do you feel in those experiences?
Please spend some time describing experiences you feel least engaged during a typical day: What are you doing? Who are you with? How do you feel in those experiences?

Positive Relationships.instructions:
Instructions: Relationships are fundamental to our health, well being and meaning in ife. The goal of this exercise is to evaluate the relationships in your life. Take a brief moment to think about your relationships with other people in your life, such as family, friends, significant others, colleagues at work or school. The goal of this exercise is to evaluate the relationships in your life. 

Please start by rating your relationships and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: I am generally satisfied with the quality of relationships in my life
What is good about your relationships and why?
What do you feel is missing from your relationships with other people?
Do you feel like you could be a better contributor to your relationships with others? How so?

Meaning.instructions:
Instructions: Experiencing meaning in your life is essential for your health and well being. Meaning is about understanding yourself and your role in the world, and you tend to understand yourself through experiences and the meaning you make out of them, having a purpose which is an aspiring aim and contributing to some greater good which is how your life positively impacts the life of others. 

Please start by rating your meaning and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: My life is valuable
I am able to make sense of the pathway my life has taken
My life serves a greater purpose
What gives your life purpose?
What are you doing currently in life that is meaningful?
What are you doing currently in life that is not meaningful?

Accomplishment.instructions:
Instructions: A sense of accomplishment is the perception that you are progressing and succeeding in your daily life: personally, professionally, or socially. Having a sense of accomplishment contributes to your well being. by contributing to a sense of personal direction and impacting your overall sense of self-worth. 

Please start by rating your physical health and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: I am generally satisfied with what I have accomplished in life
Please describe specific accomplishments you are most proud of and why you are proud of them.
What do you feel like you have yet to accomplish?
What barriers are preventing you from achieving these accomplishments?
What accomplishments are you currently working towards?

Physical.instructions:
Instructions: Our physical health has many implications across both mental and physical domains. Positive physical health buffers against mental health disorders and is essential to psychological wellbeing. Positive physical health is more than just the absence of disease. it is the state of optimal physiological functioning. The physical health pillar is composed of sleep, exercise, nutrition, and stress, all of which contribute to our. 

Please start by rating your Physical Health and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: I typically feel physically healthy
I typically get enough sleep
I typically manage my stress well
I typically feel energized after eating
I typically incorporate enough movement and exercise into my life
Please spend some time describing the factors that contribute to your overall nutritional needs
Please spend some time describing factors that contribute to your overall sleep quality.
Please spend some time describing the ways in which you enjoy incorporating movement and exercise into your life.
Please spend some time describing how you approach stress management.

Mindset.instructions:
Instructions: There are two main dimensions to mindset. The first refers to having a growth or a fixed mindset. A growth mindset refers to believing that you can improve your skills, abilities and intelligence with effort while a fixed mindset is believing that your skills, abilities and intelligence are unchangeable. Those who have a growth mindset tend to have greater success and performance in school, work and life. 

Please start by rating your mindset and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: I can think of many ways to reach my current goals
I can solve most problems if I invest the necessary effort
Sometimes I make myself do things that will help me live a better life, even if I don’t want to
The future holds a lot of good in store for me
Do you generally believe you are capable of solving problems you are faced with in life? Why or why not?
How do you normally respond when faced with an obstacle?
Do you tend to look at the glass half full or empty? Why or why not?

Environment.instructions:
Instructions: Environment refers to the physical setting you spend most of your daily life in, such as the quality of your physical environment, access to natural light, and time in nature. Environment can impact both your physical health and your well being. 

Please start by rating your environment and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: I typically have access to natural light during the daytime)
I typically spend time in settings that are physically comfortable )
I can conveniently access nature in my life (parks, oceans, and mountains)
How do you feel about the physical environments you spend the most time in?
How does the time you spend in these environments contribute to your well being?
Which physical environments do you most enjoy spending time in?

Economic.instructions:
Instructions: Your control of financial matters is a strong predictor of your well being. Economic security is the impact your level of income, spending, and savings have on your well being. Economic security is less about the objective state of your finances and more about how you perceive your finances. Depending on a multitude of factors, some people feel comfortable with less money, while others with more money may still feel anxious or lacking. 

Please start by rating your economic security and then address the free-response questions. Remember to write as honestly and in depth as you can manage. This ensures Atlas will have better information to base its assessments and recommendations on when helping you to positively influence your well being. For Likert Scale Response Items, please indicate your level of agreement ranging from a 1 (Strongly Disagree) to a 7 (Strongly Agree).

questions.question: I am comfortable with the current state of my finances
Do you feel like there is a comfortable balance between the amount of money you make and the amount of money you spend each month? Why or why not?
Are you comfortable with the amount of financial assets you have access to? Why or why not?
Are you comfortable with your ability to pay for adequate health-care? Why or why not?
Overall, do you feel on track to meet your major financial goals? Why or why not?
